alert.note: Alert for Franklin; St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 12:44PM EST until February 27 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Franklin County in northern New York... St. Lawrence County in northern New York... * Until 130 PM EST. * At 1241 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 13 miles north of St. Lawrence State Park to near Ogdensburg to 28 miles west of Cedar Island State Park, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Visibility of less than one quarter mile in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes portions of NY 11 between Malone and Gouverneur. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Massena, Gouverneur, Ogdensburg, Canton, Norfolk, Lisbon, Louisville, Moira, De Kalb, Bangor, Fowler, Parishville, Fort Covington, Colton, Bombay, Morley, Degrasse, Massena International Airport - Richards Field and Helena. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
